questions.question: Smoking is bad for your health. Fact or opinion?
The cheetah is the fastest land animal. Fact or opinion.
Do adverts use facts or opinions?

choices.answer: Adverts use both facts and opinions

questions.question: Which of these statements is a fact?

choices.answer: I read 20 pages of that book.
I thought that book was too long.

questions.question: Which of these statements is an opinion?
Wearing glasses can help you to see better. Fact or opinion?
Most people have a mobile phone now. Fact or opinion
The government knows best. Fact or opinion?
Will a reference book contain more facts or more opinions?
Cigarette smoke smells awful. Fact or Opinion?
Do celebrity magazines contain more facts or opinions?
If you read a review of a film, is that more likely to be fact or opinion?
Which of these is a fact?

choices.answer: The TV programme should be on earlier.
The TV programme is very funny.
The TV programme is a repeat.

questions.question: War is always wrong. Fact or opinion?

imageMetadata.resources:
This is an opinion. Although some people think war is always wrong;
others think that some wars are justified. So there is no way to prove this statement .

questions.resources:
This is an opinion. Although some people think war is always wrong;
others think that some wars are justified. So there is no way to prove this statement .

questions.question: Many innocent people are killed in war. Fact or opinion?

imageMetadata.resources: This is a fact. It can be proved by looking at newspapers and statistics.

questions.resources: This is a fact. It can be proved by looking at newspapers and statistics.

questions.question: The quality of life has decreased in the last ten years. Fact or opinion

imageMetadata.resources:
This is an opinion. Others might think differently. Quality of life is
difficult to measure.

questions.resources:
This is an opinion. Others might think differently. Quality of life is
difficult to measure.

questions.question: Wild animals should not be kept in zoos. Fact or opinion?

imageMetadata.resources:
This is an opinion. Some people argue that wild animals should not
be kept in zoos, but others say that it supports conservation. So it cannot be proved.

questions.resources:
This is an opinion. Some people argue that wild animals should not
be kept in zoos, but others say that it supports conservation. So it cannot be proved.

questions.question: Parents should be allowed to smack children if they misbehave. Fact or opinion?

imageMetadata.resources:
This is an opinion. Some people believe that parents should be
allowed to smack children if they misbehave, but others are against this.

questions.resources:
This is an opinion. Some people believe that parents should be
allowed to smack children if they misbehave, but others are against this.

questions.question: According to the latest survey, families are purchasing more household items on credit.

imageMetadata.resources:
This is a fact. A survey provides evidence to back up a fact. In this
case the people who conducted the survey talked to a sample of people to find out this
information. The answers to these questions have been counted and a statement made
based on the results

questions.resources:
This is a fact. A survey provides evidence to back up a fact. In this
case the people who conducted the survey talked to a sample of people to find out this
information. The answers to these questions have been counted and a statement made
based on the results

questions.question: Governments must invest more in the environment. Fact or opinion?

imageMetadata.resources:
This is an opinion. It may be widely accepted, but it cannot be called
a fact unless a poll or survey provides evidence to back up this statement.

questions.resources:
